metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Git Tutorial
Learn Git
Git is a tool that helps you:
Where to use Git?
Git works on your computer, but you also use it with online services like GitHub , GitLab , or Bitbucket to share your work with others. These are called remote repositories .
content.html: Git works on your computer, but you also use it with online services like GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket to share your work with others. These are called remote repositories.

content.text: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to use Git for your own projects and how to connect with remote repositories online.
content.html: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to use Git for your own projects and how to connect with remote repositories online.

content.text: Learning by Examples
In this tutorial, we will show you Git commands like this:
content.html: In this tutorial, we will show you Git commands like this:

content.code_html:
git --version
git version 2.30.2.windows.1

content.text: For new users, using the terminal view can seem a bit complicated.
content.html: For new users, using the terminal view can seem a bit complicated.

content.text: Don't worry! We will keep it really simple, and learning this way gives you a good grasp of how Git works.
content.html: Don't worry! We will keep it really simple, and learning this way gives you a good grasp of how Git works.

content.text: In the code above, you can see commands (input) and output.
content.html: In the code above, you can see commands (input) and output.

content.text: Lines like this are commands we input:
content.html: Lines like this are commands we input:

content.code_html: git --version

content.text: Lines like this are the output/response to our commands:
content.html: Lines like this are the output/response to our commands:

content.code_html: git version 2.30.2.windows.1

content.text: In general, lines with $ in front of it is input.
content.html: In general, lines with $ in front of it is input.

content.text: These are the commands you can copy and run in your terminal.
content.html: These are the commands you can copy and run in your terminal.

content.text: Tip for Beginners: Don't worry about making mistakes!
content.html: Tip for Beginners: Don't worry about making mistakes!

content.text: When you use Git on your own computer, you can't really break anything important.
content.html: When you use Git on your own computer, you can't really break anything important.

content.text: Experimenting is a great way to learn, and you can always undo or redo changes as you go.
content.html: Experimenting is a great way to learn, and you can always undo or redo changes as you go.

content.text: Change Platform:
What Changes When You Switch Platform?
The tutorial can show examples for GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.
content.html: The tutorial can show examples for GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket.

content.text: The Git commands are mostly the same, but some steps (like connecting to a remote or pushing code) might look a little different depending on the platform you choose.
content.html: The Git commands are mostly the same, but some steps (like connecting to a remote or pushing code) might look a little different depending on the platform you choose.

content.text: Use the menu to see examples for each platform.
content.html: Use the menu to see examples for each platform.

content.text: Why Practice with Exercises?
Practicing with exercises helps you remember the commands and understand how Git works.
content.html: Practicing with exercises helps you remember the commands and understand how Git works.

content.text: Try the exercises and quiz to test your knowledge!
content.html: Try the exercises and quiz to test your knowledge!

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page

content.html: Start Git Quiz

content.text: Track Your Progress
Create a free W3Schools account and get access to more features and learning materials:

content.html: Note: This is an optional feature. You can study at W3Schools without creating an account.
